intro: Linosyris serrulata, commonly known as the serrated linseed plant, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and parts of North Africa. It belongs to the family Scrophulariaceae and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and opposite leaves with serrated edges. The plant produces small, tubular flowers that are typically pink or purple, arranged in clusters at the ends of the branches. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or sandy habitats. Linosyris serrulata is valued for its ornamental appeal and historical use in traditional medicine.
